net.proteusframework.ui.search

Interface QLBuilder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    JoinedQLBuilder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    QLBuilderImpl

    public interface QLBuilder
    Utility for managing the construction of a query language statement.

    This is designed to be used in situations where multiple non-cooperating search criteria can be used to build an QL statement. For example, two criteria may need to join the same table to specify a constraint. In this case, the QLBuilder maintains the aliases so that an additional join is not generated. In another common case, a parameterized constraint needs to be uniquely referenced. Again, the QLBuilder manages this information to avoid a conflict with the parameter name.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • appendCriteria

        QLBuilder appendCriteria(String fragment)
        Append a fragment to the where clause.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • appendCriteria

        QLBuilder appendCriteria(String columnName,
                       PropertyConstraint.Operator operator,
                       Object value)
        Append criteria to the where clause.

        This is equivalent to calling formatCriteria("%s.%s %s %s", getAlias(), columnName, operator.getSymbol(getDialect()), param("columnName", value))

        Parameters:
        columnName - the column or property name.
        operator - the operator.
        value - the value.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • appendQLStatement

        void appendQLStatement(QLBuilderImpl.ParameterContext parameterContext,
                     boolean includeLimit,
                     StringBuilder ql)
        Append the QL statement to the QL StringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        parameterContext - the parameter context.
        includeLimit - the limit flag.
        ql - the QL StringBuilder.

      • createInnerJoin

        JoinedQLBuilder createInnerJoin(String relationName)
                                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Create an inner join.

        If this is SQL, then a join condition is required.

        Parameters:
        relationName - the relation name.
        Returns:
        a builder representing the join. For example, calling getAlias() on this builder returns the alias parameter.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified arguments are invalid according to the contract.

      • createJoin

        JoinedQLBuilder createJoin(QLBuilder.JoinType type,
                         String relationName,
                         String alias)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Create a join.

        If this is SQL and not a QLBuilder.JoinType.CROSS join, then a join condition is required.

        Parameters:
        type - the join type.
        relationName - the relation name.
        alias - optional alias. If not specified, then a shared alias is used by calling createSharedAlias(String).
        Returns:
        a builder representing the join. For example, calling getAlias() on this builder returns the alias parameter.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified arguments are invalid according to the contract.

      • createQLStatement

        String createQLStatement(QLBuilderImpl.ParameterContext parameterContext,
                       boolean includeLimit)
        Create the query language statement.
        Parameters:
        parameterContext - the parameter context.
        includeLimit - flag to determine if limit and offset are included in the QL statement.
        Returns:
        the statement.

      • createSharedAlias

        String createSharedAlias(String relationName)
        Create a shared alias for the specified relation name for use in createJoin(JoinType, String, String).

        This is useful in cases where you want to use the same alias for multiple independent calls to createJoin(JoinType, String, String), since joins are created per unique combination of relation name, join type, alias, and condition.

        Parameters:
        relationName - the relation name.
        Returns:
        the alias.

      • createUniqueAlias

        String createUniqueAlias()
        Create a unique alias for use in createJoin(JoinType, String, String).

        This is useful in cases where you want to force multiple joins to the same relation name (e.g. multiple ANDed criteria).

        Returns:
        the alias.

      • createUniqueParameterName

        String createUniqueParameterName(String parameterName)
        Create a unique parameter name.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the parameter name.
        Returns:
        the unique parameter name. The specified parameter name if it is not in use or it hasn't been reserved. Otherwise, a new parameter name is returned.

      • doSetOp

        QLBuilder doSetOp(String setAlias,
                QLBuilder.SetOperation operation,
                QLBuilder... builders)
        Create a new QLBuilder to represent the specified set operation.

        At the time this was written HQL didn't support set operations.

        This is the same as calling doSetOp(alias, operation, Duplicate.DISTINCT, builders)

        Parameters:
        operation - the operation.
        builders - the other builders. At least one builder must be specified.
        setAlias - the set alias.
        Returns:
        a new builder that represents the result of the set operation.

      • doSetOp

        QLBuilder doSetOp(String setAlias,
                QLBuilder.SetOperation operation,
                QLBuilder.Duplicate duplicateOption,
                QLBuilder... builders)
        Create a new QLBuilder to represent the specified set operation.

        At the time this was written HQL didn't support set operations.

        Parameters:
        operation - the operation.
        duplicateOption - the duplicate option.
        builders - the other builders. At least one builder must be specified.
        setAlias - the set alias.
        Returns:
        a new builder that represents the result of the set operation.

        Returns:
        the property value. May be null.

      • hasParameter

        Test if the specified parameter has already been defined (e.g. putParameter(String, Object)).
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the name.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • isCollection

        boolean isCollection(Object value)
        Test if the specified value is a collection.
        Parameters:
        value - the value.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • param

        String param(String parameterName,
           Object parameterValue)
        Put a parameter and return the parameter name.

        Useful for writing code like builder.formatCriteria("column = %s", builder.param("param", value));

        Parameters:
        parameterName - the parameter name.
        parameterValue - the parameter value.
        Returns:
        the parameter name prefixed with a colon.

      • putParameter

        Object putParameter(String parameterName,
                  Object parameterValue)
        Put the parameter.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the name.
        parameterValue - the value.
        Returns:
        the previous value or null if not previously specified.

      • removeParameter

        Object removeParameter(String parameterName)
        Remove a parameter.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the parameter name.
        Returns:
        the value set for that parameter name.

      • setFirstResult

        QLBuilder setFirstResult(Integer firstResult)
        Set the first row to retrieve.
        Parameters:
        firstResult - a row number.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • setMaxResults

        QLBuilder setMaxResults(Integer maxResults)
        Set the max results.
        Parameters:
        maxResults - the max results. An invalid value such as null or a value less than 1 disables the specification of max results.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • setOrderBy

        QLBuilder setOrderBy(String orderBy,
                   Object... args)
        Set the order by clause.

        Example: setOrderBy("LastName DESC, FirstName DESC")

        Parameters:
        orderBy - the order by clause.
        args - optional arguments for string formatting.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • setProjection

        QLBuilder setProjection(String projection,
                      Object... args)
        Set the projection clearing anything previously set.
        Parameters:
        projection - the projection. The caller is responsible for escaping the projection if needed.
        args - optional arguments for string formatting.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • setProperty

        Object setProperty(Object key,
                 Object value)
        Set a property on the QLBuilder. Properties are used to pass additional information with the QLBuilder. This is generally only used by the code that created the QLBuilder.
        Parameters:
        key - the key.
        value - the value.
        Returns:
        the previous value or null.

      • setQLResolverOptions

        QLBuilder setQLResolverOptions(QLResolverOptions options)
        Set the QLResolver options.
        Parameters:
        options - the options.
        Returns:
        this.

      • startGroup

        QLBuilder startGroup(JunctionOperator operator)
        Start a grouping for a clause.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • uniqueParam

        String uniqueParam(String parameterName,
                 Object parameterValue)
        Put a parameter and return the parameter name which may be different than the specified parameter name. createUniqueParameterName(String) is called on the specified parameter. The result is returned, prefixed by a colon.

        Useful for writing code like builder.formatCriteria("column = %s", builder.uniqueParam("param", value));

        Parameters:
        parameterName - the parameter name.
        parameterValue - the parameter value.
        Returns:
        the parameter name prefixed with a colon.
